title: Touching Computers: Creating Data Talismans
subtext: a workshop weaving digital and physical worlds
descriptionMd:
I made "[SIGIL I](https://spencer.place/creation/SIGIL-I/)" to be my first *webstone*, a handheld ceramic sculpture that holds my website. I carry my website around in my pocket and "give" my website to people I meet by tapping their phones with the talisman. But these stones aren’t just limited to holding websites. They can be infused with any digital media, from a message to a nostalgic image to a favorite song, and even programmed to take actions like sending messages to friends or joining a wifi network. These webstones can be molded (much like clay) in both form and function into intimate portals for their creators’ identities.
In this workshop, we’ll interweave the physical and digital worlds and create a clay computing sculptures using natural air-dry clay.  After, we'll explore how these "touching computers" can create a foundation for an intimate communal exchange. Attendees will leave with their own functional data talisman.
I’ve hosted this workshop internationally across 3 different cities for several hundred people now. Each time I’m still blown away by the creativity that attendees come with and the generosity they show in their gifts to one another. From tiny ceramic phones to phone parents to miniatures of pets that pull up a photos album to apartment guestbooks, people are always making a new creation that combines physical and digital craft into a single artifact.
**Workshop History**
- ([Kids edition](https://spencer.place/creation/touching-computers-magic-stones)) June 2025 at Index Space in New York: parents and kids create magical stones together to create healthy rituals with their devices
- ([found objects edition](https://spencer.place/creation/touching-computers-nfc-as-ritual)) June 2025 at One Art Space in New York: participants bring trinkets, everyday objects, and meaningful artifacts from their lives to augment with computation
- 09/24/24 at Hex House in New York
- 07/28/24 for **[Fidget Camp](https://fidgetcamp.com/)** in San Francisco
- 07/21/24 at **[Trust](https://trust.support/)** in Berlin
- 05/04/24 **ancient futures** at Stanford University in San Francisco
- 04/24/24 at **[madsci](https://www.madsci.io/)** in San Francisco
**Interested in hosting it with your team, company, or event?**
I’m generally around San Francisco and New York City and can customize the length and set of activities for 10-100 people. Designers, engineers, and creatives, in general, have really taken to this experience and have been able to apply the concepts to their other work. Email me at [spencer@spencer.place](spencer@spencer.place) to discuss details!
